info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 6:09PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL MCDOWELL AND NORTHWESTERN RUTHERFORD COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 609 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Marion, or 7 miles southeast of Old Fort. This storm was drifting slowly south. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Lure, Shingle Hollow, Sugar Hill, Thermal City, Union Mills, and Fero. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
